title: Specialist Partner Engagement for Infrastructure Delivery
description: Gridora, a new joint venture formed by ADQ, IHC, and Modon Holding, will collaborate with specialist partners to deliver large-scale, high-impact infrastructure projects across the UAE and internationally. The platform seeks partnerships with companies offering technical expertise, construction, technology integration, and project management to accelerate delivery and expand the range of projects implemented.
example: An international engineering firm specializing in green building technologies could partner with Gridora to design and build eco-friendly smart city infrastructure in Abu Dhabi. This partnership would bring advanced sustainable solutions to major urban developments, providing the engineering firm with a high-profile reference project and Gridora with best-in-class expertise and global standards compliance.
roadmap: step 1: Identify infrastructure needs and project opportunities in collaboration with Gridora.
step 2: Propose joint solutions leveraging specialist partner’s technical expertise.
step 3: Secure project contracts and mobilize resources for design and implementation.
step 4: Integrate technology and sustainable practices into project execution.
step 5: Monitor project delivery, ensuring compliance with local and international standards.
step 6: Showcase successful implementation for mutual brand enhancement and future contract opportunities.
source_name: ADQ, IHC and Modon form new infrastructure platform ‘Gridora’ to accelerate the development of strategic projects

title: Infrastructure Investment Collaboration
description: Gridora’s dual-focus business lines include Infrastructure Investments, inviting capital providers and financial institutions to participate in infrastructure asset management and co-investment opportunities for major regional and global infrastructure projects. This allows investment partners to gain exposure to stable long-term infrastructure yields and diversify portfolios.
example: A global pension fund could co-invest with Gridora in a new logistics hub project in the UAE, leveraging Gridora’s asset management strengths to gain steady returns from operation fees and asset appreciation, while supporting regional economic development.
roadmap: step 1: Financial institution conducts due diligence on Gridora’s pipeline and asset performance.
step 2: Formulate co-investment terms with Gridora’s investment division.
step 3: Commit capital to specified projects (e.g., logistics/transport hub, energy infrastructure).
step 4: Participate in joint asset management and governance.
step 5: Collect periodic returns and performance assessments.
step 6: Reinvest or expand portfolio upon successful project completion and operation.
source_name: ADQ, IHC and Modon form new infrastructure platform ‘Gridora’ to accelerate the development of strategic projects

title: Technology Integration for Smart Cities and Connected Living
description: Gridora enables the creation of smart cities defined by intelligent and connected living, offering opportunities for technology companies to integrate IoT, big data analytics, and urban mobility solutions into infrastructure projects.
example: An IoT solutions provider could deploy a network of connected sensors and analytics services across a new Gridora-backed smart city development, enhancing energy efficiency, traffic flow, and public services. This can create new monetizable service layers for both Gridora and the technology partner.
roadmap: step 1: Identify smart city project(s) within Gridora’s delivery pipeline.
step 2: Engage with Gridora and Modon Holding to scope and tailor IoT or smart systems deployment.
step 3: Integrate technology during infrastructure build phase.
step 4: Collaborate on management and maintenance of smart systems.
step 5: Collect data and optimize city operations for additional service upsells.
step 6: Market successful deployment to secure additional contracts in the region.
source_name: ADQ, IHC and Modon form new infrastructure platform ‘Gridora’ to accelerate the development of strategic projects

title: Procurement Streamlining for Infrastructure Supply Chains
description: Gridora aims to streamline procurement for key infrastructure contracts, presenting opportunities for suppliers of construction materials, equipment, and services to become preferred vendors for large-scale national and international projects.
example: A building materials manufacturer could secure a long-term supply contract for multiple Gridora projects, ensuring consistent demand and strategic positioning in the region’s infrastructure value chain.
roadmap: step 1: Register as an approved supplier with Gridora’s procurement team.
step 2: Submit bids for supply of materials/services for specific upcoming projects.
step 3: Secure framework agreement covering multiple projects and phases.
step 4: Deliver on supply milestones and maintain product quality standards.
step 5: Expand engagement to cover additional projects or geographies with Gridora.
source_name: ADQ, IHC and Modon form new infrastructure platform ‘Gridora’ to accelerate the development of strategic projects

title: Public-Private Partnership (PPP) Models for Strategic Infrastructure
description: Gridora’s role as a joint platform for PPPs creates openings for global companies to enter public-private partnership models for infrastructure development, sharing risk and capturing value from publicly-backed expansion projects.
example: A global mobility tech company could form a PPP with Gridora to develop and operate a new urban transit line in Abu Dhabi, benefiting from government support while gaining foothold in an expanding city.
roadmap: step 1: Identify infrastructure needs fitting PPP frameworks.
step 2: Negotiate PPP terms including revenue sharing, performance guarantees, and risk allocation.
step 3: Structure financing, construction, and operational roles for both public and private partners.
step 4: Launch project and manage its operation collaboratively.
step 5: Monitor performance and report to both private stakeholders and public sector partners.
source_name: ADQ, IHC and Modon form new infrastructure platform ‘Gridora’ to accelerate the development of strategic projects
